Hare and Hyena 
 Mutugi Kamundi 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Long time ago Hare and Hyena were 
 great friends. 
 
 
 They did many things together. 
 
 
 They danced and sang together. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One day, Hare said, “My friend Hyena, let
 us start farming together and we wil be
 rich.” 
 
 
 “Oh yes, we can plant a lot fod, harvest
 it, and sel it to others,” Hyena said.
 
 
 “But what shal we plant?” asked Hare.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena sugested that it was god to 
 
 plant maize. Hare agred. 
 
 Hare also told Hyena that it was god for 
 
 them to share duties on the farm. 
 “My work wil be guarding the maize from 
 birds,” said Hare. 
 
 
 Then Hare told Hyena to til the land, 
 
 plant, and wed. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena complained that he had ben
 given more work. But Hare told Hyena
 
 that the work of chasing birds was the
 most dificult and most important.
 
 
 “My work is not easy. I wil be climbing
 tres and chasing birds away day and
 
 night. And you are not able to climb a
 tre,” Hare explained. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena was convinced by Hare's words. 
 He agred to til the land alone. It was a 
 
 lot of work. Hare did not help at al. 
 
 After tiling the land, Hyena planted 
 
 maize in the whole field, alone. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 When weds grew in the field, Hyena
 
 used a hoe to wed. It was a lot of work.
 
 
 Hare sat on a rock singing: 
 
 “My friend is a worker, 
 
 I am his adviser. 
 He works like a tractor, 
 I am his manager. 
 
 The soil he toils, 
 The hils he tils, 
 
 The seds he plants, 
 The weds he cuts, 
 The maize we harvest.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When the maize was almost ready, Hare 
 
 enjoyed himself singing in the field to 
 kep birds away. Chasing the birds was 
 not a hard job. He did not sweat at al. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Finaly, the maize was ready to harvest.
 Hare told Hyena that they would share
 
 the harvest betwen themselves. 
 
 Hare said, “I wil harvest everything that
 
 grows above the soil and you wil harvest
 everything that grows below the soil.”
 
 
 Hyena thought that it was a god idea.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hare said, “I wil first get my harvest then 
 you wil harvest yours.” 
 
 
 So Hare harvested al the maize in the 
 field and put it in his store. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena went to harvest things that grew
 below the soil. He dug, hoping to get a
 god harvest. But he only found rots
 
 under the soil. He dug everywhere. He
 did not find anything to harvest.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena realised that he had ben cheated. 
 
 He was angry. He returned home 
 carying empty baskets. 
 
 
 In the evening he went to Hare’s home 
 very anoyed. He told Hare, “Let us now 
 
 farm together again my friend.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena told Hare, “This time I wil harvest
 everything that grows above the ground
 
 and you wil harvest everything that
 grows below the soil.” 
 
 
 Hare acepted. He told Hyena that
 instead of planting maize it was god to
 
 change the crop. They agred to plant
 potatoes. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena also insisted that this time they 
 
 would both do the diging, planting and 
 weding. Hare acepted. So they worked 
 on the farm together, singing. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When the potatoes were ready, Hare told
 Hyena to harvest what grows above the
 ground. 
 
 
 Hyena went loking for something to
 harvest. But he did not find anything. He
 
 only found potato leaves. He went back
 home with empty baskets. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 14  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hare harvested a lot of big potatoes. He 
 
 put them in his store. 
 
 When Hyena saw Hare’s harvest, he was 
 
 anoyed. “Why did you cheat me?” Hyena 
 asked Hare. 
 
 
 Hare explained that it was Hyena himself 
 who chose to harvest the things that 
 
 grew above the soil. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 15  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Hyena was very angry. He chased after
 Hare in order to get revenge. But Hare
 
 ran away fast. 
 
 Since that day, Hare and Hyena have not
 
 ben friends. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 16
